intro: Ophiorrhiza longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepaled sandmat, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in coastal sandy soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are simple, opposite, and have a distinctive waxy coating. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release its seeds, aiding in its dispersal in sandy environments.
